articles.title: Kim Jong Il Provides Field Guidance to Songjin Steel Complex
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Provides Field Guidance to Songjin Steel Complex
Pyongyang, April 23 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il provided field guidance to the Songjin Steel Complex giving full play to the advantages of the Juche iron production.
					 He went round for hours various production processes to learn in detail about technological updating and production there.
					
					 Watching molten iron flowing down from the Juche iron furnace, he was greatly satisfied to see the complex keeping the Juche iron production going at a high rate. He highly praised the officials, workers and technicians of the complex for having devoted their wisdom and enthusiasm to displaying the advantages of the Juche iron production system.
					
					 The Juche iron production system has been established and technological updating gained in depth, bringing about a radical change in the complex's structure and production there, he said, adding that this stirring reality in the complex is a striking proof of the validity and great vitality of the WPK's line on realizing the Juche orientation of the national economy.
					
					 Noting that the successful realization of the Juche orientation of metal industry through painstaking efforts for decades marks the biggest-ever event as it provided a new landmark in the nation's history of industry, he said that the Juche orientation is the invariable path to be followed by the DPRK's economy.
					
					 The foundation of the independent national economy of the DPRK has been cemented and the level of the country's industrialization has reached a higher stage thanks to the devoted struggle of all the people, he said, adding that this enormous potential provides a sure guarantee for accomplishing the cause of building a thriving nation.
					
					 It is of very weighty importance for building an economic power to develop steel industry, he said, setting forth the tasks facing the complex.
					
					 Underscoring the need to dynamically push forward the drive to build new production processes in order to steadily increase the iron and steel production, he specified the orientation and ways to do so.
					
					 Then, he went round a duck farm to acquaint himself with the supply service at the complex. 
					
					 All affairs including production are going on well at the complex thanks to good supply service, he said, highly praising again the party and administrative officials of the complex for making tenacious efforts, retaining a firm hold on the supply service.
					
					 He had a photo session with the labor innovators of the complex.
					
					 He once again ardently called for dynamically conducting an all-out offensive and an all-out drive for breakthrough to translate the desire of President Kim Il Sung to build a rich and powerful country into reality and thus commemorate the centenary of his birth as the greatest holiday of Kim Il Sung's nation and a great auspicious event in human history.
					
					 He was accompanied by Kim Ki Nam, member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the C.C., the WPK, Kim Kyong Hui, member of the Political Bureau and department director of the C.C., the WPK, Jang Song Thaek, alternate member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK and vice-chairman of the NDC, Thae Jong Su, alternate member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the C.C., the WPK, Ju Kyu Chang, alternate member of the Political Bureau and department director of the C.C., the WPK, Ri Myong Su, minister of People's Security, and Hyon Chol Hae, department director of the NDC.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Receives Congratulatory Messages and Letters
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Receives Congratulatory Messages and Letters
						
Pyongyang, April 23 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received congratulatory messages and letters from various countries on the occasion of the 18th anniversary of his election as chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK.
					 The senders include the secretary general of the Union Solidarity and Development Party, Union of Myanmar, the general secretary of the Central Committee of the Bangladesh Communist Party, the general secretary of the C.C., the Communist Party of Bangladesh (Marxist-Leninist), the chairman of the C.C., the Workers’ Party of Bangladesh, the chairman of the Central Executive Committee of the Bangladesh National Socialist Party, the general secretary of the C.C., the Socialist Party of Bangladesh, the president of the Bangladesh People’s League, the general secretary of the Syrian Arab Democratic Union Party, the general secretary of the Al Ahd al Watani Party of Syria, the chairman of the Central Council of the People Unity-“Kyrgys El” Republican Political Party, the chairman and the secretary general of the National Guidance Council of the Pioneer Party of Indonesia, the chairman of the Communist Party of Germany, the chairman of the Supreme Council of the Socialist Party of Romania, the chairman of the Romanian Socialist Union, the chairwoman of the Party for Peace and Unity of Russia, the general secretary of the C.C., the Czechoslovak Communist Party, the chairman of the C.C., the Communist Party of Czech and Moravia and the chairman of the National Executive Committee of the Polish Communist Party.
					
					 Also sending messages and congratulatory letters were the secretary of the C.C., the Slovak Communist Party, the chairman of the “International Kim Il Sung Foundation” and other high-ranking personages in political, social, military and economic fields of Russia, Nepal, Bangladesh, Denmark, Romania, Sweden, the Czech Republic, Finland, Poland, Austria, Democratic Congo, Ethiopia, Peru and Ecuador as well as the representatives of the international organizations, groups for the study of the Juche idea and the organizations for supporting Korea’s reunification and friendship organizations.

articles.title: Floral Basket to Kim Jong Il from Japanese Priest
articles.content:
Floral Basket to Kim Jong Il from Japanese Priest 
						
 Pyongyang, April 23 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a floral basket from Ekan Ikeguchi, high priest of the Saifukuji-temple,    on the occasion of the 79th birthday of the Korean People's Army.
					 The floral basket was handed over to an official concerned on Saturday.

articles.title: DPRK Boasts of Invincible Army
articles.content:
DPRK Boasts of Invincible Army
						
 Pyongyang, April 23 (KCNA) -- The Korean people are greeting the anniversary of the heroic Korean People's Army (KPA), which falls on April 25.
					 Founded nearly eighty years ago, the KPA has developed to be an invincible army with sophisticated offensive and defensive means under the guidance of the great leader and the great party.
					
					 Its development is closely related with the outstanding and sagacious leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 After formulating the Songun (military-first) politics as the socialist political mode, he has inspected many army units to make all the soldiers steadfast in ideology and faith.
					
					 Regarding the military affairs as the most important national priority, he has defended the nation, revolution and socialism and propelled the overall socialist construction with the army as the core. 
					
					 Under his leadership, a revolutionary soldier spirit symbolizing the Songun era has been created in the army and close unity between the army and people in ideology and working spirit has been achieved successfully.
					
					 With the KPA, which has become a strong army through two wars against the Japanese and U.S. imperialists and the arduous struggle to defend the country, remaining faithful to the revolutionary cause of Juche, the DPRK has striven to build a thriving nation under the leadership of Kim Jong Il, frustrating the aggressive moves of the imperialists.

articles.title: Benevolent Politics for Great National Unity
articles.content:
Benevolent Politics for Great National Unity
Pyongyang, April 23 (KCNA) -- The patriotic and benevolent politics pursued by President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il encouraged Korean people of various social strata to turn out in the effort for the country's reunification.
					 President Kim Il Sung invited Kim Ku, a die-hard nationalist of south Korea, to the historic joint conference of representatives of political parties and public organizations in north and south Korea in Pyongyang in April Juche 37 (1948), with no regard to his anti-communist career.
					
					 He valued patriotism more than any political view. Touched by his benevolent politics, south Koreans who had been active in the political, military, business and religious circles in south Korea started with a clean slate. 
					
					 His idea of great national unity has been successfully carried forward by leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 When Jong Ju Yong, honorary chairman of the Hyundai Group of south Korea, joined in the effort for national reunification, the leader appreciated his patriotic decision.
					
					 When he died, Kim Jong Il sent a message of condolence to the bereaved family and dispatched a delegation of mourners to Seoul along with a wreath. He also took measures to let Jong's patriotic effort for the country's reunification go down through generations.
					
					 Kim Jong Il's benevolent and all-embracing politics ushered in an era of achieving national reunification in line with the June 15 north-south joint declaration.
					
					 His policy and idea for great national unity and reunification enjoy full support from all Koreans at home and abroad.

articles.title: S. Korean Conservative Authorities' Anti-Reunification Acts Censured
articles.content:
S. Korean Conservative Authorities' Anti-Reunification Acts Censured
 Pyongyang, April 23 (KCNA) -- The Secretariat of the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea issued a memorandum on Saturday condemning internally and externally the south Korean conservative authorities for denying dialogue and driving the inter-Korean relations to catastrophe while persistently escalating the confrontation with compatriots and perpetrating anti-reunification acts. 
					 As soon as the present south Korean conservative group came to power, it stopped all dialogues overnight and trampled on all the successes achieved thanks to the north-south joint declarations, the memorandum said, and went on:
					
					 A number of dialogues and contacts for implementing the October 4 declaration including the first meeting of the panel for cooperation in railways between the north and the south, the north-south working contact for revitalizing the tour of Mt. Kumgang and the first meeting of the panel for cooperation in roads between the north and the south which were held between the DPRK and the former south Korean authorities in Kaesong between the end of January and February of 2008 ended without any results.
					
					 After the emergence of the regime in February of 2008 the puppet group declared its moves against dialogue as a policy, bringing them to an extreme phase.
					
					 More than 20 north-south dialogues including the second north-south premiers' talks and the second vice premier-level meeting of the north-south joint committee for economic cooperation expected to take place in the first half of 2008 and cooperation undertakings were scuttled, bringing them to an end.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Slashes at Japan's Invariable Militarist Ambition
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Slashes at Japan's Invariable Militarist Ambition 
 Pyongyang, April 23 (KCNA) -- The ultra-right politicians of Japan again paid a group visit to "Yasukuni Shrine".
					 54 dietmen belonging to the "Association of Dietmen for Visiting 'Yasukuni Shrine'" flocked to the shrine on Friday to stir up militarism in the wake of the visit by the president and the vice-president of the Liberal Democratic Party on Thursday. 
					
					 These visits could not but stun the international community as they took place at a time when it is greatly concerned about the nuclear disaster cause by the killer earthquake and the ensuing tsunami.
					
					 The world is cautious about the militarist behaviors of the Japanese reactionaries who visit the shrine even under the present state of emergency.
					
					 The shrine is a symbol of militarism as it keeps the mortuary tablets of top war criminals of the Japanese imperialists including Tojo, the boss of militarism, who committed all sorts of atrocities by perpetrating aggression and plunder of Asian countries in the period of World War II. So, it is cursed and hated by the Asian people.
					
					 Nevertheless, the Japanese reactionaries remain unchanged in their objective to justify and revive the Japanese imperialists' blood-stained history of aggression with Yasukuni Shrine as an ideological and moral mainstay of militarism.
					
					 By encouraging the visit to the shrine, they are extolling war criminals and inculcating the idea of supporting the history of aggression in the Japanese people, not guilty conscience, in a bid to militarize the Japanese society and create a social atmosphere for reinvasion.
					
					 It is the ulterior aim of the Japanese reactionaries to hurl young Japanese and other people equipped with the militarist idea into overseas aggression when time comes.
					
					 It is quite natural for the international community to closely follow the moves of the Japanese reactionaries blinded by the ambition for overseas aggression to infuse the militarist idea into the people and remain highly vigilant against Japan.
					
					 Japan's reinvasion is bound to lead to self-destruction.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries would be well advised to halt their rash militarist acts, not forgetting the bitter lesson drawn from the defeat the Japanese imperialists sustained while frantically invading Asia.

articles.title: KCNA on "Democracy" Touted by US
articles.content:
KCNA on "Democracy" Touted by US 
 Pyongyang, April 23 (KCNA) -- It was disclosed recently that the United States secretly offered funds to the dissident organizations in Syria. 
					 The Washington Post on April 18 quoted the information disclosed by WikiLeaks as saying that the U.S. Department of State has provided 12 million U.S. dollars to the dissident organization in Syria since 2005. According to it, this U.S. financial support has been invariably given under this administration since the days of the Bush administration as it was aimed to bring down the present Syrian government. 
					
					 As the international community became increasingly vocal censuring and protesting the U.S., its Department of State came out to justify the financial support, claiming it only backed "democracy" in Syria. 
					
					 The deputy spokesman for the department openly disclosed the fact that it has pushed forward its plan to put spurs to the anti-government activities in Syria and other countries. 
					
					 As seen above, "democracy" touted by the U.S. is nothing but a blatant move for aggression as it is aimed to bring down the governments and political systems in the countries it eyes and, furthermore, Americanize the world. 
					
					 Every country has the right to freely choose its ideology and system according to the UN Charter and international law. 
					
					 The U.S. moves under the veil of "democracy" are little short of political terrorism to put the world under its control. They are a blatant violation of the UN Charter and international law and a grave infringement upon the sovereignty and human rights of sovereign states. 
					
					 The reality indicates that the U.S. moves for world domination have entered into a more reckless phase under the signboard of "democracy".
					
					 Unpardonable are the imperialists' cunning and heinous infringement upon sovereignty and state-sponsored terrorism under the veil of human rights and democracy. 
					
					 The countries and nations that value independence should heighten vigilance against the U.S. aggressive and hegemonic moves under the signboard of "democracy" and decisively foil them.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on Independent Economy
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on Independent Economy 
 Pyongyang, April 23 (KCNA) -- Independent economy provides a material guarantee for independent politics, says Rodong Sinmun Saturday in a bylined article.
					 The imperialists are resorting to base moves to economically isolate and stifle those countries pursuing independent politics, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 A solid independent economy can provide a material backing to independent politics and makes it possible for countries to advance along the road of independence undeterred by economic sanctions and blockade of the imperialists.
					
					 Some countries that had once followed the road of independence against imperialism were taken in by the intrigues of the imperialists mainly because they failed to build a solid independent economy.
					
					 A country strong in economic independence can certainly break through the economic sanctions and blockade of the imperialists but a country with weak economy is affected by them and comes under their control.
					
					 If a country allows its economic independence to be weakened or to be lost, duped by the imperialists' honey word called "globalization" of economy, it will entail grave consequences.
					
					 When a people lives, benefited from the independent economy built by their efforts and with the sweat of their brow, they can protect the dignity of the nation and pursue independent politics in line with their will and requirements.
					
					 To develop South-South cooperation is an essential requirement of the developing countries to ensure economic independence.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on Kim Il Sung’s idea of Great National Unity and His Feats
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on Kim Il Sung's idea of Great National Unity and His Feats
						
 Pyongyang, April 23 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Saturday refers to President Kim Il Sung’s idea of great national unity and his feats in a bylined article dedicated to the 63rd anniversary of the Joint Conference of Representatives of Political Parties and Public Organizations in North and South Korea.
					 The joint conference held in Pyongyang in April, Juche 37 (1948) on his initiative and under his guidance was attended by representatives of 56 political parties and public organizations in the north and the south. It was a national conference to save the destiny of the country and the nation by achieving the great national unity under the banner of reunification and patriotism in the period when the nation was in the danger of permanent division.
					
					At the conference the President considered it as the greatest political task before the Korean nation to check and frustrate the plots to hold "separate elections" to establish "a separate government" in south Korea and establish a democratic unified government in order to reunify the country. As a way to implement it he laid down a policy calling on all those who were concerned about the destiny of the country and the nation to get united irrespective of political grouping and affiliation and political view.
					
					A wide-ranging great national conference was held to discuss the crucial issue of the nation and an agreement was reached there with a unanimous approval to launch a nation-wide struggle for national salvation against the U.S. This was the precious fruition of the President's independent line of national reunification, the idea of great national unity and all-embracing politics, the article says, and goes on:
					
					The great idea of great national unity maintained by the President all his life and his feats are a precious legacy left by him to the Korean people and a reliable wherewithal for achieving the cause of the country's reunification.
					
					The basic spirit of the joint conference which aroused all the Koreans to the nation-wide struggle for national salvation against the U.S. and the President's idea of great national unity and vitality of his leadership have been clearly proved during the past 63 years when the Koreans have waged a strenuous movement for national reunification. The joint conference proved in practice that Koreans can win a great victory in the struggle for accomplishing the common cause of the nation if they desire independence and unity though they differ in ideology and ism and political view and religious faith.

articles.title: S. Korean Puppet Forces' Abduction of DPRK's Inhabitants Blasted
articles.content:
S. Korean Puppet Forces' Abduction of DPRK's Inhabitants Blasted
 Pyongyang, April 23 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet group abducted more than 30 inhabitants of the DPRK when they were drifted in the sea and conducted an operation to force them to "defect" to the south. Some of them are still kept in custody. 
					 Minju Joson Saturday observes in a by-lined commentary in this regard: 
					
					 This is an undisguised serious provocation against the DPRK as it was a thrice-cursed hideous abduction committed by the scoundrels utterly indifferent to humanitarianism and international practice.
					
					 What merits a serious attention is that the group persistently conducted the operation for their defection defying the DPRK's repeated demand for their repatriation. 
					
					 An ulterior aim sought by the group in the abduction of the inhabitants and the operation for their defection was to keep them in custody in south Korea in a bid to tarnish the image of the DPRK and further strain the inter-Korean relations and, furthermore, use them for its smear campaign to escalate the confrontation with fellow countrymen.
					
					The above-said abduction can never be tolerated. 
					
					 Those who go mad with the confrontation with compatriots will have to pay dearly for their crimes. 
					
					 The puppet group should halt the moves to escalate the confrontation and send the detained inhabitants back to the north without delay so that they may reunite with their families.

articles.title: Tourism Is Passport for Peace: S. Korean Tourism Official
articles.content:
Tourism Is Passport for Peace: S. Korean Tourism Official
 Pyongyang, April 23 (KCNA) -- Tourism is like a passport for peace. Pak Pyong Jik, chief of the South-North Tourism Center of the Tourism Company of south Korea, said this at round-table talks in Seoul on April 21. The tour of Mt. Kumgang was suspended due to the south Korean authorities' acts of escalating confrontation.
					 Expressing hope that tour would serve as an occasion of turning effect in mending the south-north relations, he said that south Korea is, in fact, experiencing difficulties in attracting foreign tourists.
					
					 The Korean nation should find the way for co-existence by developing a tour course involving areas in the south and the north, he said.

articles.title: Special Zone for Peace and Cooperation in West Sea Called for in S. Korea
articles.content:
Special Zone for Peace and Cooperation in West Sea Called for in S. Korea
						
Pyongyang, April 23 (KCNA) -- At least 20 civic organizations in the area of Inchon, south Korea including the Inchon Solidarity for Peace and People's Involvement and the Inchon Citizens Federation for Economic Justice and the "Consultative Council of Non-governmental Organizations for Cooperation with the North" held a joint press conference at the Inchon City Office on April 20 at which they called for peace in the West Sea of Korea.
					 The organizations said that the vital rights of the Inchon citizens are seriously threatened by the ceaseless confrontation between the south and the north.
					
					 They urged the authorities to stop military exercises in the waters of the West Sea which may spark military clashes and set up as early as possible a special zone for peace and cooperation in the West Sea as clarified by the October 4 declaration.

articles.title: Prison Term Imposed upon S. Korean Inhabitant for Praising DPRK
articles.content:
Prison Term Imposed upon S. Korean Inhabitant for Praising DPRK
Pyongyang, April 23 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet Suwon District Court on April 20 sentenced an inhabitant to one year and six months in jail on charges of the violation of the ill-famed "National Security Law". He posted on his Internet an article praising the DPRK.
					 The court inflicted such punishment on him by invoking the fascist law, claiming that his article analyzing the Yonphyong Island shelling case amounted to praising the Songun politics of the north.

articles.title: Struggle for Punishing Treacherous Regime Called for in S. Korea
articles.content:
Struggle for Punishing Treacherous Regime Called for in S. Korea
						
 Pyongyang, April 23 (KCNA) -- The Solidarity for Democracy, People's Life, Peaceful Reunification and Sovereignty of south Korea issued a statement on April 19 calling for actions to punish the treacherous "government".
					 The April 19 Popular Uprising that broke out 51 years ago against the dictatorial forces of Syngman Rhee who pursued pro-U.S. sycophancy and national division created a new history of the movement for democracy, the statement said.
					
					  It accused the south Korean authorities of staging ceaseless anti-DPRK war rackets to escalate the military tension and pursuing corrupt policies based on deception and self-righteous practices, throwing the people into distress.
					
					 The progressive forces will actively turn out in the struggle to punish the present regime, carrying forward the fighting spirit of the participants in the uprising.
					
					  In the meantime, the Society of April Revolution of south Korea held a commemoration in Seoul on Monday on the occasion of the 51st anniversary of the uprising.
					
					  The speakers said at the event that it is the most pressing task to punish the conservative forces and build a new democratic society.
					
					  They called on the progressive forces to get united and stage a vigorous struggle under the uplifted banner of the June 15 joint declaration to this end.

articles.title: Actions for Guarantee of Students' Rights Called for in S. Korea
articles.content:
Actions for Guarantee of Students' Rights Called for in S. Korea 
 Pyongyang, April 23 (KCNA) -- Members of civic and public organizations and school youth and children of south Korea called a news conference in Seoul on April 19 calling upon the people of various circles to turn out in the actions for the guarantee of students' rights. 
					 Speakers at the news conference said that violations of freedom and rights of students were going on at schools. 
					
					 They held that in order to put an end to this reality there should be an institutional mechanism protecting the rights of the students. 
					
					 They called on the students and their parents and civic and public organizations to actively turn out in the actions to institute a law for the guarantee of human rights. 
					
					 Then the participants staged a demonstration.

articles.title: Repeal of "National Security Law" Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Repeal of "National Security Law" Demanded in S. Korea 
						
 Pyongyang, April 23 (KCNA) -- The Association for Supporting Prisoners of Conscience of the Family Movement for Realizing Democracy of south Korea on April 16 made public a report in which it held that the victims of the "National Security Law," a fascist law, has sharply increased since the emergence of the present puppet regime. 
					 According to it, the number of those who were booked on charges of violation of the NSL under the present regime swelled 3.5 times that under the preceding regime. 
					
					 Members of the South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification, the Solidarity for Implementing the South-North Joint Declaration and the Solidarity for Progress who legally visited the DPRK during the period of the former "government" were booked or imprisoned on charges of violation of NSL after the emergence of the present "government." 
					
					 The number of cases of illegal wiretapping committed under the pretext of investigation into violation of NSL more than quadrupled as compared with that in the period of the preceding "government". 
					
					 Citing these facts, the association said that the NSL's infringement upon even the elementary freedom of people would be intensified if the "Grand National Party"-introduced proposal for the retrogressive revision of the law aiming at "dissolution of enemy-benefiting organizations" passes through the "National Assembly".

articles.title: Actions for Abolition of Fascist Law Declared
articles.content:
Actions for Abolition of Fascist Law Declared 
Pyongyang, April 23 (KCNA) -- The Society of Victims of the "National Security Law" of south Korea in a statement on April 20 declared actions for the abolition of the fascist law. 
					 The statement said: Due to the NSL pro-reunification personages and patriots of conscience are subject to unbearable sufferings. They are meeting deaths and socially ostracized. 
					
					 It is shame that the NSL is still in force though its repeal was urged even by an international organization. 
					
					 In order to reunify the country divided by foreign forces and advance toward the future of prospering reunified country it is necessary to abolish the fascist law obstructive to independent reunification. 
					
					 The victims of the NSL will boost the solidarity with all forces of conscience and devotedly struggle for the repeal of the evil law, independence, democracy and reunification, declared the statement.

articles.title: Meeting Held to Express Thanks to Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Meeting Held to Express Thanks to Kim Jong Il 
Pyongyang, April 23 (KCNA) -- A meeting of officials of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) and compatriots was held at the Korean Hall in Tokyo on April 21 to express thanks to General Secretary Kim Jong Il for sending educational aid fund and stipends for the children of Koreans in Japan.
					 Present there were Pae Jin Gu, vice-chairman and concurrently director general of the General Affairs Department of the Chongryon Central Standing Committee, Kim Sun Chol, director of the Education Department of the Central Standing Committee of Chongryon, leading officials of organizations and enterprises, teachers of Korean schools, Korean scientists and students studying at Japanese universities and compatriots.
					
					 Ku Tae Sok, chairman of the Central Standing Council of the Korean Educational Association in Japan, said in his report that Kim Jong Il sent the 157th  installment of  educational aid fund and stipends on the occasion of the significant Day of the Sun, extending profound thanks to him.
					
					  He said that the compatriots in Japan are deeply moved to receive the warm loving care shown again by Kim Jong Il in the wake of his sending of relief fund to the Koreans in Japan who suffered great damage due to the massive earthquake and the ensuing tsunami.   President Kim Il Sung sent educational aid fund and stipends to the children of the compatriots who were undergoing sufferings in the alien land during the arduous and grim period when the people in the homeland were busy with the post-war rehabilitation and construction, he recalled, adding that this loving history is given steady continuity by Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Speeches were made at the meeting.
					
					 A message of thanks to Kim Jong Il was read out at the meeting.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Exploits Praised by Indonesian Official
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Exploits Praised by Indonesian Official 
 Pyongyang, April 23 (KCNA) -- Hari Untoro Dradjat, head of the visiting Indonesian government cultural delegation, told KCNA as follows: 
					 During the stay I took part in the opening ceremony of the 13th Kimilsungia Festival. 
					
					 I was deeply moved to see an endless stream of visitors to the festival venue. 
					
					 The world progressives, too, highly appreciates the greatness of President Kim Il Sung. 
					
					 The President performed undying exploits on behalf of the times and history. 
					
					 He founded the immortal Juche idea to clearly show the road ahead of mankind to follow in the era of independence, and this feat of his is shining with brilliance. 
					
					 He is the greatest man in the world. 
					
					 We will make positive contribution to further developing the relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries provided by President Kim Il Sung together with President Sukarno.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Praised by KFA Chairman
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Praised by KFA Chairman
Pyongyang, April 23 (KCNA) -- Alejandro Cao de Benos, chairman of the Korean Friendship Association headquartered in Spain, said that General Secretary Kim Jong Il is the peerlessly great man and brilliant commander of Songun.
					 Whenever I witness the reality of the DPRK, I would deeply feel about the validity and vitality of the Songun politics pursued by Kim Jong Il, he said, and went on:
					
					 The DPRK is demonstrating its dignity as a powerful and prosperous country as it is led by the peerlessly great man. 
					
					 Kim Jong Il is a great man with far-sighted wisdom, iron-will and matchless courage. 
					
					 He is the great brilliant commander exalting Korea with his unique Songun politics. 
					
					 It is he who is making immortal contribution to global independence. 
					
					 The progressive mankind are ardently praising him as the most prominent, elder statesman in the present era.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Exploits Praised in Ghana and Portugal
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Exploits Praised in Ghana and Portugal 
						
 Pyongyang, April 23 (KCNA) – A political party of Ghana and an organization of Portugal issued statements on the occasion of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The National Democratic Congress of Ghana on April 14 said in a statement that the party and other world progressive forces fully supported the great Juche idea.
					
					 The President is always remembered by mankind as he firmly maintained the stand that the peoples of all countries should live in peace and harmony, opposed to aggression and subjugation against other countries, the statement noted.
					
					 The Portugal-Korea Friendship Association in its statement on April 12 praised the President as a prominent great man as he founded the Juche idea and clearly indicated the way for the Korean people and the world progressives to follow.
					
					 He is boundlessly revered not only by the Korean people but by progressive mankind for the undying exploits he performed for socialism and global independence, the statement added.

articles.title: DPRK's Important Days Observed in Different Countries
articles.content:
DPRK's Important Days Observed in Different Countries
Pyongyang, April 23 (KCNA) -- Events took place in various countries between April 8 and 10 on the occasion of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung, the 18th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's election as chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and the 79th birthday of the Korean People's Army.
					 They included a seminar and a film show in Thailand, a meeting and a film show in Poland and a lecture in Romania.
					
					 Participants of film shows watched Korean films "Fireworks for a Thriving Nation" and "Reply of Korea".
					
					 Songchit Pullarp, chairman of the Organization for the Study of the Juche Idea of Thailand, said that the exploits performed by the President for the Korean revolution and the world revolution are always remembered by progressive mankind.
					
					 Juzef Lachut, chairman of the National Executive Committee of the Polish Communist Party, and Roman Orszewski, chairman of the Union of Polish People's Army, noted that thanks to the Songun politics of Kim Jong Il the DPRK today is winning victory only in building a thriving nation, undeterred by the hostile forces' moves.
					
					 Daniel Dediu, chairman of the Romanian Workers' Association, said that the noble cause of the President has been successfully carried forward by Kim Jong Il, an outstanding thinker and theoretician, a prominent statesman and an ever-victorious brilliant commander of Songun.

articles.title: Birth Anniversary of Kim Il Sung Commemorated Abroad
articles.content:
Birth Anniversary of Kim Il Sung Commemorated Abroad
						
 Pyongyang, April 23 (KCNA) -- Commemorations were held in different countries between April 10 and 13 on the occasion of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 They included a joint seminar in Russia and meetings, photo exhibitions, film shows and joint performance in Mexico, Mongolia, India and Belarus.
					
					Displayed in the venues of the events were works of the President and General Secretary Kim Jong Il, photos on their exploits and books and photos on the vitality of the Songun politics.
					
					 Films shown included Korean films "The Tower of the Juche Idea" and "Firework for a Thriving Nation".
					
					 Mikhail Panchenko, general secretary of the International Alliance of Societies for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Policy in East European and Central Asian Regions, made a report at the joint seminar to be followed by speeches.
					
					 The reporter and speakers praised the President for his immortal feats performed for the country, the revolution, the times and history.
					
					 Jesus Antonio Carlos Hernandez, general secretary of the C.C., the People's Socialist Party of Mexico, said in his speech that the Korean people and the world progressives would commemorate the centenary of birth of the President as the greatest holiday of Kim Il Sung's nation and the great auspicious event in the human history.
					
					 D. Bilegt, general secretary of the Federation of Peace and Friendship Organizations of Mongolia, said that the President founded the Juche idea and wisely led the Korean revolution and the struggle for global independence.
					
					 Anita Chopra, president of the Indian Working Women Society for Study of the Juche Philosophy, noted that the revolutionary cause of Juche pioneered by the President has been steadfastly carried forward by Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The repertoire of the joint performance included Korean and Mongolian songs.
					
					 Messages to Kim Jong Il were adopted at the events in Russia, India and Belarus.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Published in Russia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Published in Russia 
 Pyongyang, April 23 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "Let Us Carry Out the Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung's Instructions for National Reunification" was published in booklet by the Khabarovskaya Krayevaya Tipografia Publishing House of Russia on April 14. 
					 The work published on August 4, Juche 86 (1997) deals with the immortal exploits performed by Kim Il Sung for national reunification, formulates the three principles of national reunification, the 10-point programme of the great unity of the whole nation and the proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo as the three charters for national reunification and indicates tasks and ways for achieving the reunification of the country on the basis of them.

articles.title: Serious Meltdown of Nuclear Fuel Rods at Fukushima Nuclear Power Plant
articles.content:
Serious Meltdown of Nuclear Fuel Rods at Fukushima Nuclear Power Plant
 Pyongyang, April 23 (KCNA) -- Nuclear fuel rods are melting at the Fukushima Nuclear Power Plant of Japan, further deepening the crisis. 
					 On Monday the Japan Ministry of Economy, Trade and Industry admitted the meltdown of nuclear fuel rods at Reactors Nos. 1, 2 and 3 of the plant. Radioactive substances were detected in the pool of the building which houses a turbine because they cannot leak unless nuclear fuel rods are melted 
					
					 Sources said that the Japanese government has so far asserted that fuel rods were slightly damaged while denying the view of experts that the nuclear fuel rods might be melted due to the successive explosion of reactors. 
					
					 The Japanese newspaper Tokyo Shimbun Thursday published the results of the measurement made by the Tokyo Electric Power Co. of the total amount of radioactive substances that leaked into the sea from the plant from April 1 to 6. 
					
					According to them, 520 tons of high concentration of contaminated water flowed into the sea from the pool close to the intake of Reactor No. 2 of the plant. The total amount of radiation surpassed 5,000 TBq. This is 20,000 times the amount the Japan Nuclear and Industrial Safety Agency allows the plant to release outdoors annually, the paper said.
					
					 A medical check was made of the mothers living in the areas about 200 km away from Fukushima Prefecture after the Japanese government declared the areas within the radius of 20 km centering the plant as areas for blockade. The results of the check led to detecting traces of radioactive substance in the milk of some mothers.
					
					 The damage by quakes and the ensuing tsunami is on the steady increase. 
					
					The Japan National Police Agency said that the death toll increased to 14,001 and those unaccounted for to 13 660 as of 18:00 Tuesday.
					
					 The number of the families and households still left without the supply of electricity and water in the quake-afflicted areas reached three million and 150,000 respectively.
					
					 250 fishing ports were damaged in Iwate and Miyagi prefectures and the Ministry of Agriculture, Forest and Fisheries estimated that the amount of direct economic loss in the fishery field in the stricken areas would reach 180 billion yen.
					
					 Aftershocks are going on.
					
					 A 6 magnitude quake jolted Chiba Prefecture on the night of Thursday. Its epicenter was 70 km deep in the waters off the prefecture.
					
					  A 5 magnitude quake jolted the waters off Fukushima Prefecture at the dawn of Friday.
					
					 It was reported that this quake greatly shook buildings in Tokyo and other places, throwing inhabitants into uneasiness. 
					
					 The Meteorological Agency warned that more than 6 magnitude quake might occur in the future.
					
					  Meanwhile, quake experts at Tohoku University were of the view that the seabed of the waters off Miyagi Prefecture moved 31 metres east-southeastward due to the recent massive quake.

articles.title: Confidence in Government Falls in Japan amid Nuclear Crisis
articles.content:
Confidence in Government Falls in Japan amid Nuclear Crisis 
						
 Pyongyang, April 23 (KCNA) -- Voices critical of the present Japanese government is rising amid nuclear crisis in Japan.
					 According to the Asahi Shimbun's opinion poll Monday, 67 percent of the respondents made negative estimation of the activities conducted by the government to cope with the accident at the Fukushima Nuclear Power Plant.

articles.title: Japan's Consumer Confidence Tumbles in March after Massive Quake
articles.content:
Japan's Consumer Confidence Tumbles in March after Massive Quake 
 Pyongyang, April 23 (KCNA) -- Japanese consumer confidence plunged in March from a month earlier as the devastating impact of the March 11 earthquake, tsunami and ongoing nuclear crisis weighed heavily on the nation's economic outlook, a Cabinet Office report showed Tuesday.
					 According to the government report, consumer sentiment among households made up of two or more people, which includes views on incomes and jobs, fell from 41.2 in February to 38.6 in March, marking the index's lowest level since June 2009.

articles.title: President of Ukraine Calls for Cooperation to Cope with Nuclear Disaster
articles.content:
President of Ukraine Calls for Cooperation to Cope with Nuclear Disaster 
 Pyongyang, April 23 (KCNA) -- Viktor Yanukovich, president of Ukraine, at a recent press conference called on all countries to cooperate in the efforts to cope with accidents at nuclear power plants. 
					 Saying that no country can eradicate single-handed the aftermath of such disasters at nuclear power plants as those in Chernobyl and Fukushima, he stressed that it would be possible to effectively cope with the disasters only when countries cooperate with each other.

articles.title: China Supports Reasonable, Necessary UN Security Council Reforms
articles.content:
China Supports Reasonable, Necessary UN Security Council Reforms
 Beijing, April 21 (KCNA) -- China supports reasonable and necessary reforms for the Security Council of the United Nations, Foreign Ministry spokesman Hong Lei said in a recent interview.
					 Sanya Declaration was released at the BRICS Leaders Meeting in South China's resort city of Sanya.
					
					It said: Leaders of the BRICS Countries reiterated the need for a comprehensive reform of the UN, including its Security Council. As regards this, he said that China's stand remains unchanged over this issue.
					
					 "China supports reasonable and necessary reforms for the U.N. Security Council to make it more representative for developing countries, especially for African countries," Hong said.
					
					 China advocates UN member states to seek "a package of" solutions and reach the broadest consensus with patient and democratic consultation, he added.

articles.title: Meeting of Talented Army Personnel Held in China
articles.content:
Meeting of Talented Army Personnel Held in China 
 Beijing, April 21 (KCNA) -- A meeting of talented army men took place in Beijing on April 20.
					 Hu Jintao, president of the Central Military Commission of China, congratulated the meeting. He called upon the participants to make efforts to train highly qualified and talented military personnel of new type and make active contribution to promoting the scientific development of defence and army building.

articles.title: Strengthened Political and Ideological Building of Units Called for in China
articles.content:
Strengthened Political and Ideological Building of Units Called for in China
						
 Beijing, April 21 (KCNA) -- Xu Caihou, member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., and vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Communist Party of China, underscored the need to strengthen the political and ideological building of the units. He said this when recently providing field guidance to units in Ninxia Hui Autonomous Region and Gansu Province.
					 He called on the army to implement the order of President Hu Jintao and the Central Military Commission and improve the political and ideological building with main emphasis on building the defence and army and thus promote the building of units in all aspects from a new starting point.

articles.title: New Eco-Friendly City to Appear in Hunchun, China
articles.content:
New Eco-Friendly City to Appear in Hunchun, China
 Beijing, April 21 (KCNA) -- China plans to build a new eco-friendly city in the border economic cooperation zone in Hunchun City, Jilin Province of China.
					 The zone has favorable geographical conditions as it is on the borders of China, the DPRK and Russia on the lower River Tuman. It is 93 km away from Rajin Port, DPRK and 41 km away from Vladivostok, Russia. 
					
					 The plan envisages the construction of basic facilities, public service and industrial areas and residential districts during the 2011- 2013 first stage project and the construction of the expanded parts of the city during the 2014-2020 second stage project. 
					
					 The city will channel lots of funds into the project.

articles.title: Russian PM Calls for Expanding Foundation of Sports
articles.content:
Russian PM Calls for Expanding Foundation of Sports
						
 Moscow, April 21 (KCNA) -- Russian Prime Minister Vladimir Putin, addressing a ceremony to proclaim the start of the finals for "Gold Puck" of the children's hockey tournament, underscored the need to expand the foundation necessary for the nation's sports. 
					 The tournament is one of the most prestigious children's contests with a history of nearly five decades, he said, adding that this helps provide a good foundation for sports development and train skilful hockey players.
					
					 He clarified the stand of the government to make all efforts to expand the foundation of sports.

articles.title: First Run-through of Military Parade Made in Russia
articles.content:
First Run-through of Military Parade Made in Russia
						
 Moscow, April 21 (KCNA) – The first run-through of the military parade for celebrating the Day of Victory took place at St-Petersburg, Russia on April 18.
					 About 3,500 officers and men in the western military district of Russia, servicemen of Interior Forces and cadets of military academies took part in the military parade.
					
					 Involved in it were combat technical equipment including multiple launch rocket system, air defence missile systems and mobile tactical missiles.

articles.title: Iraqi PM Rejects Delay of American Troops Pullout
articles.content:
Iraqi PM Rejects Delay of American Troops Pullout 
 Pyongyang, April 23 (KCNA) -- Iraqi Prime Minister Nuri al-Maliki on Saturday told visiting U.S. House of Representative Speaker John Boehner that the Iraqi forces are ready and capable to protect the country, implying a delay of American troops pullout would be unnecessary.
					 According to a statement released by his office, during the evening meeting Maliki said "the Iraqi armed forces have become capable to bear responsibility to maintain security and to do their job efficiently."

articles.title: Cambodia Plans to Launch Its First Satellite
articles.content:
Cambodia Plans to Launch Its First Satellite 
 Pyongyang, April 23 (KCNA) -- Cambodia plans to launch its first satellite in 2013. 
					 Preparations for it are now under way. 
					
					 The satellite will reportedly greatly contribute to the nation's economic development.

articles.title: Anti-terror Actions Intensified in Chechnya
articles.content:
Anti-terror Actions Intensified in Chechnya 
 Moscow, April 21 (KCNA) -- The Republic of Chechnya of Russia is channelling sustained great efforts into the anti-terror actions. 
					 As of March this year, 21 terrorists were killed and about 70 criminals arrested in the republic. 
					
					 The operations resulted in confiscating a lot of illegally traded arms, explosives and more than 14,000 rounds of ammunition. The Ministry of Interior of Chechnya announced this on April 20.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il dirige el Astillero de Rajin
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il dirige el Astillero de Rajin
Pyongyang, 23 de abril (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y Presidente del Comité de Defensa Nacional de la República Popular Democrática de Corea, dirigió sobre el terreno el Astillero de Rajin.
					Luego de escuchar la explicación ante el plano del Astillero, se enteró detalladamente del estado de construcción de barcos recorriendo varios procesos productivos.
					
					Se mostró muy satisfecho de que los funcionarios, obreros y técnicos de la empresa trabajaran con abnegación y entusiasmo por construir una patria próspera mostrándose optimistas y confiados en el futuro.
					
					Evaluó altamente las hazañas de la clase obrera del Astillero que vino acatando con fidelidad la idea y la dirección del partido y el líder, señalando que ella ha hecho en el pasado muchos barcos usando el espíritu revolucionario de autoconfianza y de lucha tenaz y superando con audacia todas las dificultades y pruebas y aportó así enormemente al desarrollo de industria naval del país.
					
					Gracias a la sabia dirección del Presidente Kim Il Sung, se fundó una poderosa industria naval en nuestro país, que antes de la liberación, no pudo fabricar ni una barca, apuntó.
					
					Gracias a ello, se construyen hoy modernos barcos de diferentes tipos mostrando la gran vitalidad de la economía nacional independiente, recalcó.
					
					Presentó las tareas que incumben al Astillero de Rajin diciendo que éste ocupa posición importante en el desarrollo de industria naval del país.
					
					Dado que nuestro país está rodeado por el mar en sus tres lados, la construcción de los barcos pesqueros y los cargueros de gran tamaño resulta muy importante para desarrollar más la industria pesquera, el transporte marítimo y el comercio exterior, apuntó y agregó que el Artillero de Rajin debe seguir luchando por hacer mucho más barcos.
					
					La industria naval es un índice importante del nivel de desarrollo industrial de cada país, dijo e indicó que el artillero debe desarrollar más la técnica de construcción de barcos y asentar su proceso sobre la base científica y moderna, de modo que se recorte el período de ese trabajo y se eleve constantemente su calidad.
					
					Agregó que hay que introducir activamente la ciencia y la tecnología de punta y dinamizar el movimiento masivo por la innovación técnica, en particular, aplicar la tecnología de control digital en el diseño de barcos con computadora, la elaboración y el montaje de cascos.
					
					Subrayó que para construir mucho más barcos, los sectores relacionados deben producir y suministrar a tiempo los materiales, equipos y materias primas necesarios.
					
					Expresó la gran esperanza y convicción de que la clase obrera de aquí cumplirá bien su honrosa misión y deber para demostrar su ímpetu heroico y espíritu indoblegable en la construcción de la gran potencia próspera.
					
					Le acompañaron en esta ocasión Kim Ki Nam, miembro del Buró Político y secretario del CC del PTC, Kim Kyong Hui, miembro del Buró Político y jefa de departamento del CC del PTC, Jang Song Thaek, miembro suplente del Buró Político del CC del PTC y vicepresidente del CDN, Thae Jong Su, miembro suplente del Buró Político y secretario del CC del PTC, Ju Kyu Chang, miembro suplente del Buró Político y jefe de departamento del CC del PTC, Ri Myong Su, ministro de Seguridad del Pueblo, y Hyon Chol Hae, jefe de departamento del CDN.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il ve función artística de unidad combinada 264 de EPC
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il ve función artística de unidad combinada 264 de EPC
						
Pyongyang, 23 de abril (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Presidente del Comité de Defensa Nacional de la República Popular Democrática de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejército Popular de Corea, presenció la función del grupo de propaganda artística de la gran unidad combinada 264 del EPC.
					Cuando el Dirigente apareció en el palco, todos los ejecutantes y espectadores le acogieron hospitalariamente rindiéndole el máximo honor.
					
					Los ejecutantes pusieron en la escena el coro "El soldado rinde cálido saludo al Líder", el coro masculino "Canción del Ejército Popular de Corea", el solo femenino y pangchang "Primavera en Hoeryong", el solo femenino "A la guerra antijaponesa", la poesía y coro "Gloria a nuestro gran partido" y otras piezas de diferentes géneros.
					
					A través de la función,  ellos demostraron bien la invencible potencia del ejército revolucionario del monte Paektu sin rival, crecido bajo la guía del General Insigne, la firme convicción y voluntad de los militares del EPC de cumplir hasta el final con armas la causa revolucionaria del Juche siguiendo al Dirigente.
					
					El Dirigente dijo que los ejecutantes reflejaron bien en esta ocasión el verdadero aspecto de nuestro ejército revolucionario, que avanza a pasos firmes lleno de optimismo y con la firme concepción del líder y de la revolución, y apreció el revolucionario modo de creación de ellos que forjan la nueva cultura de la época del Songun. 
					
					Esta función es la más excelente entre los últimos espectáculos ofrecidos por los grupos de propaganda artística, señaló y expresó gratitud a todos los creadores y artistas apreciando sus éxitos excepcionales y méritos. 
					
					Los militares de nuestro ejército popular han crecido como combatientes indoblegables que tienen como su invariable convicción la disposición de defender al líder a costa de la vida y a convertirse en bombas y balas, afirmó y agregó que nuestro socialismo más ventajoso centrado en las masas populares es invencible porque ese contingente sin rival defiende firmemente las trincheras de la patria. 
					
					Es muy importante la propaganda artística en la educación ideológica sobre los militares porque tiene gran poder conmovedor y llamativo, destacó y presentó las tareas programáticas que servirán de guía en intensificar esa labor de carácter revolucionario y combativo.
					
					Disfrutaron también la función Kim Ki Nam, miembro del Buró Político y secretario del CC del PTC, Kim Kyong Hui, miembro del Buró Político y jefa de departamento del CC del PTC, Jang Song Thaek, miembro suplente del Buró Político del CC del PTC y vicepresidente del CDN, Thae Jong Su, miembro suplente del Buró Político y secretario del CC del PTC, Ju Kyu Chang, miembro suplente del Buró Político y jefe de departamento del CC del PTC, Ri Myong Su, ministro de Seguridad del Pueblo, Hyon Chol Hae, jefe de departamento del CDN, y Choe Pu Il, miembro de la Comisión Militar Central del PTC y general de ejército del EPC.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il dirige el Complejo de Acero de Songjin
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il dirige el Complejo de Acero de Songjin
						
Pyongyang, 23 de abril (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y Presidente del Comité de Defensa Nacional de la República Popular Democrática de Corea, dirigió sobre el terreno el Complejo de Acero de Songjin donde se ponen de pleno manifiesto las ventajas de la producción de acero Juche.
					Se enteró detalladamente del estado de reconstrucción técnica y producción recorriendo durante largo tiempo varios procesos productivos.
					
					Al ver la cascada del hierro fundido rojizo proveniente del alto horno de acero Juche, se mostró muy satisfecho de la normalización en alto nivel de la producción de ese metal.
					
					Evaluó altamente los éxitos de lucha de los funcionarios, obreros y técnicos del complejo quienes dedican toda su inteligencia y pasión para demostrar la superioridad del sistema de producción de acero Juche.
					
					Como resultado del establecimiento de ese sistema y de la profundización de reconstrucción técnica, se registró cambio radical en la estructura y la producción de esta empresa, señaló y subrayó que esta orgullosa realidad es una muestra contundente de la justeza y enorme vitalidad de la orientación de nuestro partido de desarrollar la economía nacional con recursos y tecnologías nacionales.
					
					Al cabo de esfuerzos perseverantes de varias décadas, se hizo posible desarrollar la industria metalúrgica de manera autóctona y con recursos nacionales, apuntó.
					
					Esto significa evento tremendo, que marcó un nuevo hito en la historia de industria nacional, señaló y ratificó que el estilo Juche es la invariable ruta de economía nacional.
					
					Dijo que gracias a la abnegada lucha de todo el pueblo, se fortaleció la base de economía nacional independiente de Corea y se elevó a una etapa más alta el nivel de industrialización del país.
					
					Enfatizó que esas potencialidades garantizan el cumplimiento de la causa de construcción de la gran potencia próspera.
					
					Señalando que desarrollar la industria de acero tiene gran importancia en la construcción de potencia económica, presentó las tareas que tiene por delante la empresa.
					
					Para aumentar de continuo la producción de materiales de hierro y acero, hay que desplegar vertiginosamente la lucha para construir nuevos procesos productivos, instruyó e indicó detalladamente el rumbo y remedios para el particular. 
					
					Acto seguido, el Dirigente hizo conocimiento de la intendencia recorriendo la granja de patos.
					
					En esta empresa marchan bien todos los trabajos incluso la producción, gracias al mejor servicio de abastecimiento para los empleados, dijo y volvió a evaluar los esfuerzos de los funcionarios partidistas y administrativos de la empresa que trabajan con empeño concentrando la fuerza a esta labor. 
					
					El Dirigente tomó una fotografía junto a los innovadores laborales de la empresa. 
					
					Exhortó una vez más ardientemente a desplegar con dinamismo la ofensiva general para llevar a la realidad el anhelo del Presidente de construir una patria próspera y así acoger el centenario del natalicio del Presidente como la máxima fiesta de la nación de Kim Il Sung y gran júbilo histórico de la humanidad. 
					
					Le acompañaron en esta ocasión Kim Ki Nam, miembro del Buró Político y secretario del CC del PTC, Kim Kyong Hui, miembro del Buró Político y jefa de departamento del CC del PTC, Jang Song Thaek, miembro suplente del Buró Político del CC del PTC y vicepresidente del CDN, Thae Jong Su, miembro suplente del Buró Político y secretario del CC del PTC, Ju Kyu Chang, miembro del Buró Político y jefe de departamento del CC del PTC, Ri Myong Su, ministro de Seguridad del Pueblo, y Hyon Chol Hae, jefe de departamento del CDN.

articles.title: CRPP publica memorando de los crímenes de autoridades surcoreanas
articles.content:
CRPP publica memorando de los crímenes de autoridades surcoreanas
Pyongyang, 23 de abril (ATCC) -- El Secretariado del Comité por la Reunificación Pacífica de la Patria (CRPP) hizo público el día 23 un memorando para revelar al interior y exterior del país la naturaleza y los crímenes anti-reunificación de las autoridades conservadoras surcoreanas que llevaron a la catástrofe las relaciones entre ambas partes coreanas persiguiendo obstinadamente la confrontación fratricida y negando el diálogo. 
					Tan pronto como tomaron el poder, las actuales autoridades surcoreanas rompieron todos los diálogos y vulneraron abusivamente los éxitos logrados por las declaraciones conjuntas N-S, señala el texto y continúa:
					
					Aun antes de recibir oficialmente el poder, ellas obstruyeron obstinadamente e hicieron infructíferos los diálogos y contactos para la implementación de la Declaración del 4 de Octubre, entre otros, la primera reunión de la Sección de Cooperación Ferroviaria Norte-Sur, el contacto de trabajo Norte-Sur para activar el turismo al monte Kumgang y la primera reunión de la Sección de Cooperación en Carreteras Norte-Sur, sesionados desde finales de enero hasta febrero de 2008 en Kaesong entre la RPDC y las autoridades antecesoras del Sur. 
					
					Desde febrero de 2008 cuando apareció oficialmente el "régimen" de ellas, sus acciones anti-diálogo se tornaron cada vez más brutales siendo refrendadas como una política.
					
					Quedaron cancelados y abortados la segunda ronda de conversaciones entre los premieres del Norte y el Sur y la segunda reunión del Comité Conjunto de Cooperación Económica Norte-Sur de nivel de vicepremier, que habían sido programadas para el primer semestre de 2008, y otros más de 20 proyectos de diálogo y cooperación. 
					
					También se llevaron a la ruptura las negociaciones de trabajo entre las autoridades del Norte y el Sur para el establecimiento de la Zona Especial de Paz y Cooperación del Mar Oeste. 
					
					En cuanto al problema de acabar con las relaciones militares hostiles N-S, lograr el alivio de tensión y preservar la paz en la Península Coreana, asumieron la actitud desafiante recrudeciendo sus actos bélicos y campaña anti-RPDC en el tema nuclear y orquestando los complots y choques armados.
					
					Ellas llevaron al fracaso total las conversaciones entre las autoridades.
					
					Inmediatamente después de su llegada al poder, el mandatario surcoreano abogó por establecer "nuevas relaciones Sur-Norte" y "afrontar el diálogo con principios y paciencia" en el primer informe del Ministerio de Reunificación y la entrevista de prensa para el pueblo, insistiendo en "cambiar la postura de negociar con el Norte" dejándose llevar por éste.
					
					En particular, el ministro de Reunificación, Hyon In Thaek, y otros connotados conservadores del Sur impidieron obstinadamente el diálogo íntercoreano planteando sofismas como "mantenimiento de principios" y "estrategia de espera".
					
					Ellos frustraron intencionalmente con su comportamiento arrogante el diálogo y el contacto difícilmente preparados y las conversaciones para la reanudación del turismo al monte Kumgang.
					
					Malemplearon en sus fines conflictivos hasta el contacto y las negociaciones de la Cruz Roja N-S para resolver los problemas humanitarios y llevaron al fracaso el diálogo previo a las conversaciones militares de alto nivel N-S.
					
					Las autoridades surcoreanas no se presentaron siquiera en el contacto de trabajo sobre la investigación conjunta de actividades volcánicas del monte Paektu, celebrado dos veces a finales de marzo y a mediados de abril, y por conducto de algunos civiles sin ninguna autoridad ni responsabilidad, reprocharon los datos abordados en esas ocasiones dando gestos de insinceridad.
					
					Debido a la prohibición de las autoridades conservadoras surcoreanas, no se pudo abrir desde junio de 2008 ningún acto de reunificación entre los diferentes sectores del Norte, el Sur y en ultramar.
					
					Específicamente, al publicar la llamada "medida del 24 de mayo" tras el incidente de hundimiento de la corbeta "Cheonan" en marzo de 2010, bloquearon totalmente el contacto y el intercambio de nivel civil.
					
					No se puede perdonar nunca tales crímenes anti-reunificación de la camarilla de Lee Myung Bak.
					
					Ellos no deben malinterpretar los esfuerzos de la RPDC por el diálogo y les convendría reflexionar seriamente de las graves consecuencias que emanen de sus actos opuestos al diálogo y a la reunificación.

articles.title: ATCC comenta la "democratización" aludida por EE.UU.
articles.content:
ATCC comenta la "democratización" aludida por EE.UU.
						
Pyongyang, 23 de abril (ATCC) -- Recientemente, fue revelado el hecho de que Estados Unidos vino financiando a las entidades antigubernamentales de Siria.
					Citando a WikiLeaks, The Washington Post transmitió el día 18 que el Departamento de Estado estadounidense ofreció 12 millones de US$ a las entidades opositoras de Siria desde 2005.
					
					Según el reporte del rotativo norteamericano, tal financiación de EE.UU. comenzó bajo la administración Bush y prosigue en la actual con el propósito de derrocar el gobierno sirio.
					
					Ante el alza de condenas y protestas en el ámbito internacional, el Departamento de Estado se justificó diciendo que lo que apoyó únicamente su gobierno fue la "democratización" de Siria.
					
					Pero, como muestra de gran cinismo, el sub-portavoz de esa cartera había publicado que EE.UU. promueve los proyectos para fomentar las actividades antigubernamentales no sólo en Siria sino en otros países también.
					
					Como se ve, la "democratización" aludida por EE.UU. es una brutal campaña agresiva para derrocar el gobierno y el régimen político del país definido como blanco y convertir luego a todo el mundo al estilo norteamericano.
					
					Cada país tiene el derecho a optar libremente su idea y régimen de acuerdo con la Carta de la ONU y la ley internacional.
					
					La "democratización" abogada por el imperio es el terrorismo político para dominar el mundo.
					
					Además, constituye una violación flagrante de la Carta de la ONU y la ley internacional y grave atentado contra la soberanía y los DDHH de los países soberanos.
					
					La realidad muestra que la campaña de EE.UU. para tomar la hegemonía mundial se torna cada día más aventurera bajo el rótulo de "democratización".
					
					No se puede perdonar jamás la astuta y vil violación de la soberanía y el terrorismo contra el poder estatal de los imperialistas que se cometen bajo el vistoso cartel de DDHH y democracia.
					
					Los países y naciones, que aprecian la independencia, deberán rechazar y redoblar la vigilancia ante la "democratización" al estilo norteamericano que persigue la agresión y la dominación.

articles.title: ATCC comenta la visita colectiva al santuario Yasukuni
articles.content:
ATCC comenta la visita colectiva al santuario Yasukuni
Pyongyang, 23 de abril (ATCC) -- Hace poco, los politiqueros ultraderechistas japoneses volvieron a visitar en colectivo al santuario Yasukuni.
					Lo hicieron el pasado día 21 el presidente y el vicepresidente del Partido Democrático Liberal y al día siguiente, 54 afiliados al "Encuentro de diputados para visitar juntos el santuario Yasukuni".
					
					Estas visitas causan más consternación si se toma en cuenta que se llevaron a cabo cuando Japón sufre la crisis nuclear proveniente del gran terremoto y subsiguiente tsunami del pasado 11 de marzo. 
					
					El mundo está alarmado ante ese acto militarista que se cometió sin falta pese a tal estado de emergencia. 
					
					En el santuario Yasukuni están conservadas las tablillas funerarias de Tojo, cabecilla de militaristas japoneses, y de otros criminales de guerra de pésima calaña que cometieron atrocidades de toda índole invadiendo y saqueando a los países asiáticos durante la segunda guerra mundial. Por eso, constituye el símbolo de militarismo y objeto de condena y odio de los pueblos asiáticos. 
					
					Es invariable el objetivo de los reaccionarios japoneses de tomarlo como pilar ideo-espiritual del militarismo y justificar y reproducir la historia de agresión ensangrentada de sus antecesores. 
					
					A través de la visita al santuario Yasukini, elogian a los criminales de guerra e infunden en la población japonesa la disposición de defender la historia de agresiones, lejos de la culpabilidad, con el fin de militarizar la sociedad japonesa, crear el ambiente social favorable a la nueva agresión, y a la larga, lanzar a las nuevas generaciones armadas con idea militarista y otros habitantes japoneses a la agresión a ultramar cuando llegue el tiempo. 
					
					Es natural que la sociedad internacional aumentara su vigilancia ante la conducta tan aventurera de reaccionarios japoneses. 
					
					La nueva agresión llevará a Japón a la autodestrucción. 
					
					Los reaccionarios japoneses deben dejar de cometer sus locuras militaristas sin olvidar la amarga lección que les enseñó su derrota en la Segunda Guerra Mundial.
